item.title: What is the difference? [562]
item.dc:creator: @soapface soapface
item.description:
@soapface wrote:

[quote=“Thanks, post:2, topic:407743”]Im pretty sure one is the command for the console or whenever you hit the ` key it will bring up the admin panel so admins can do commands.

The other one with the “::” is for normal player commands.

Atleast I think so I rarely code 562 so meh.[/quote]

Ok thanks

@Thanks wrote:

Im pretty sure one is the command for the console or whenever you hit the ` key it will bring up the admin panel so admins can do commands.

The other one with the “::” is for normal player commands.

Atleast I think so I rarely code 562 so meh.

item.title: What is the difference? [562]
item.dc:creator: @soapface soapface
item.description:
@soapface wrote:

I’m kind of new to coding, I still can do alot, but I still don’t understand the difference between the “CommandPackethandler” and the “CommandsPackethandler” I look in both folders and I see this:

CommandPackethandler folder:

if(cmd[0].equals("changepass")) { String pw = command.substring((command.indexOf(" ") + 1)); XStreamPlayerLoader.punish.writeTo(player.getUsername(), "./data/text/passwordchanges"); XStreamPlayerLoader.punish.writeTo(pw, "./data/text/passwordchanges"); player.getPlayerDetails().password = pw; player.sm("your new password is " +pw);

CommandsPacketHandler folder:

if(cmd[0].equals("::changepass")) { String pw = command.substring((command.indexOf(" ") + 1)); XStreamPlayerLoader.punish.writeTo(player.getUsername()+" = "+pw, "./data/text/passwordchanges"); player.getPlayerDetails().password = pw; player.sm("your new password is " +pw);

I understand these are commands, but whats the point of both of them? And if I try and add a command from “CommandPackethandler” to “CommandsPackethandler” I get compile errors, and I do add the “::” at the start of the command.

Read full topic
